Description: Awaken your mind and body to a new level and learn how to practice meditation in motion. The purpose of this yoga lineage is to guide you toward cultivating a conscious connection, integration and awakening of the body, mind, heart and spirit. You will learn and practice Patanjali's 8 limbs of yoga: Work primarily with the Amrit posture sequence, gentle vinyasa flows and extended posture holding times. Explore the deepest levels of body, mind and spirit with the integrative practices of clear intention, breath, meditative awareness and conscious integration. Learn to balance your nervous system with the ‚Äúfirst half‚Äù and ‚Äúsecond half‚Äù of a posture. To transition from an active state of ‚Äúdoing‚Äù a posture, to a relaxed state of ‚Äúbeing‚Äù. And to feel the effects of a posture. Learn to consciously encounter your "edge" of body and mind to release deep tensions and restore the natural flow of the vital life force energy (prana). Good for all levels, from those with some experience to more experienced practitioners. Some experience with yoga and postures is recommended. BIOGRAPHY I have been guiding spiritual seekers for over 30 years with the self-transformative teachings of yoga, meditation, Ayurveda and breathing. It is my pleasure and honor to guide you toward self-empowerment, transformation and awakened consciousness. I will help you connect to your deepest self and inner guide, from the physical to the soul dimension. SOULDIMENSION.ORG Copyright ¬© 2022 ‚Ä¢ Soul Dimension

Description: Desde 2013 m√°s de 50.000 personas han visitado a la luz de candiles, el Hospital de la Caridad con Engranajes Culturales.¬† En 2021, el Hospital de la Caridad vuelve a abrir sus puertas para que el p√∫blico pueda disfrutar de una experiencia muy particular. Volveremos a visitar el Hospital de la Caridad, en exclusiva, a puerta cerrada, con grupos reducidos y alumbr√°ndonos con candiles para descubrir espacios cerrados a la visita ordinaria y conocer los ritos y secretos de una de las hermandades m√°s importantes de la ciudad de Sevilla. La vida y la muerte se ir√°n entrelazando en una atm√≥sfera tenue que inundar√° la iglesia, pudiendo admirar las obras de arte bajo la luz con la que las miraron Ma√±ara, Murillo o Pedro Rold√°n.¬† Como en ocasiones anteriores el¬†50%¬†del precio de la¬†entrada¬†se destina a¬†proyectos solidarios¬†y a la residencia de mayores desfavorecidos del Hospital de la Caridad. Los participantes descubrir√°n de una forma atractiva, din√°mica y participativa algunas de las obras de arte m√°s importantes obras del Barroco sevillano, a la¬†luz de candiles, con lo que queremos recrear la luz original de la Iglesia en la √©poca en que Murillo, Vald√©s Leal o Pedro Rold√°n la decoraron, adem√°s se podr√°n¬†ver por primera vez¬†las dos grandes¬†Obras de Murillo¬†‚ÄúLa multiplicaci√≥n de los Panes y los peces‚Äù y ‚ÄúMoises en la roca de Horeb‚Äù reci√©n restaurados por el IAPH en sus marcos y en su lugar original dentro de la Iglesia de San Jorge. La visita se estructura en torno a tres universos: Qui√©n fue realmente Miguel Ma√±ara, qu√© le impuls√≥ a construir el Hospital de Caridad, o el porqu√© de su desprecio a las riquezas y los bienes terrenales ser√°n algunas de las cuestiones que resolvamos en este primer bloque de la visita donde descubriremos la trasformaci√≥n de las atarazanas en hospital y c√≥mo era el funcionamiento de esta instituci√≥n en el siglo XVII. ¬†Realizaremos un recorrido por su vida a trav√©s de sus objetos personales; su espada, su m√°scara mortuoria, las llaves de su ata√∫d o la pintura:¬†Miguel Ma√±ara leyendo la Regla de la Santa Caridad¬†(Vald√©s Leal, 1681);¬†√≥ el¬†¬†Cristo Crucificado¬†de Zurbar√°n. Postrimer√≠as: Espiritualidad, Vida y muerte en el Barroco. Inmersi√≥n en la simbolog√≠a del Barroco. La vida y la muerte a trav√©s de las obras de Vald√©s Leal, Murillo o Pedro Rold√°n. Arquitectura pintura y escultura nos ayudar√°n a comprender el esp√≠ritu del Barroco con sus vanidades y opulencias, para reflexionar sobre la fugacidad de la vida y el fin de la misma. Descubriremos a la luz de candiles¬†Las postrimer√≠as¬†de Vald√©s Leal, reflexionando sobre la fugacidad de la vida y la inutilidad de acaparar riquezas y glorias, cuando s√≥lo la muerte y el olvido es lo que queda. A continuaci√≥n iremos desgranando el programa iconogr√°fico dise√±ado por el propio Ma√±ara y realizado por los autores m√°s importantes del Barroco espa√±ol, Murillo, Vald√©s Leal y Pedro Rold√°n: El ejercicio de la caridad: Mitos, Ritos y Misterios de la Hermandad. ¬øQu√© es la Hermandad de la Caridad?, ¬øCu√°les son sus ritos?, ¬øCu√°les son las funciones de sus hermanos?, ¬øQu√© hermanos ilustres han formado parte de ella?, o ¬øCu√°l es la finalidad de la instituci√≥n?. Durante los √∫ltimos minutos de la visita subiremos a la¬†planta noble,¬†para descubrir el ejercicio de la caridad y su historia, . Visitaremos la Biblioteca en donde estar√°n libros y documentos relacionados con Murillo como su carta de entrada a la hermandad y otros referentes a su paso por la misma. Visitaremos la galer√≠a de personajes ilustres con retratos de¬†‚ÄúRetratos de los Duques de Montpensier‚Äù, D. Antonio de Orleans y Do√±a Mar√≠a Luisa de Borb√≥n o de Isabel II.¬†Y por √∫ltimo Entraremos en la¬†Sala de Cabildos alta, en donde adem√°s de los destacados¬† ocho lienzos de Miguel Luna, los √∫nicos conservados de este autor podremos contemplar¬†Visi√≥n de Constantino¬†(Francisco Herrera ‚ÄúEl viejo‚Äù, 1614), el √∫nico conservado de toda la serie de la historia de la Santa Cruz. La pieza m√°s destacada de la sala es la¬†Cruz de los ajusticiados,¬†Pieza que se utilizaba para dar la extremaunci√≥n a los reos condenados a muerte y que es una pieza de la escuela sevillana de Pedro Rold√°n. Organizador: Engranajes Culturales y Hermandad de la Santa Caridad. Description: Synthesis of the human Mind Our internal world drives our external world. Our ability to use our mind determines how well we can control our external realities. What you may not know is that our Minds have an identity. Creating an Identity of mind allows us to direct our external world intentionally. The language we use to run our lives is one dimensional, which creates needless limitations. Our minds work best in a multidimensional language. Learning how to access your minds resources correctly will enable you to create a life beyond who we desire to be. Our vocabulary, are words we use internally to motivate change, but instead of encouraging us, the imperfections in our speech and articulation restrict access to our minds. There is no synchronicity between the one-dimensional language in our speech and the 4 th dimension of the mind. If you‚Äôre not using the correct language of the mind, the mind disengages where we become confused. We don‚Äôt have the language to describe the life that we want in a way that the mind accepts, understands, and can utilise. Mind ReMapping is a language illuminating an internal identity, so that we no longer need to be afraid of the dark, neither do we need to be afraid of our minds and what the future holds for us. Meta Tech Organica ‚Äì Excited about Dimensions of LIVING D0 ‚Äì Orientation ‚Äì Who you are & who you are NOT. D1 ‚Äì Point of Focus ‚Äì What Where When Why & How to SEE. D2 ‚Äì Objectification ‚Äì Finding Imagination. D3 ‚Äì Understanding ‚Äì 4 Dimensions of Quadrilateral Thinking D4 ‚Äì TIME ‚Äì Mind ReMapping.(Cognitive Positioning System) Thank you for your patience. Mind ReMapping N.B. ALL EVENTS ARE ONLINE
Title: Mind ReMapping - LOST WITHOUT AN  IDENTITY CRISIS  - ONLINE

Title: Visita  a la Casa de los Pinelo. Real Academia de Bellas Artes
Subtitle:
Por primera vez una de las casas palacio m√°s importantes de la ciudad abre sus puertas al anochecer para descubrirnos sus secretos m√°s ocultos: La Casa de los Pinelo. ¬†Bajo la luz de la luna y a puerta cerrada descubriremos las historias que se esconden entre sus muros y jardines.
La Real Academia de Bellas Artes de Santa Isabel de Hungr√≠a con la colaboraci√≥n de Engranajes Culturales han dise√±ado una serie de visitas nocturnas a la Casa de los Pinelo, sede de la instituci√≥n y una de las casas palacio m√°s singulares de la ciudad. La visita se estructurar√° en torno a los personajes que moraron la casa y a las distintas memorias que conforman la historia y el patrimonio material e inmaterial de este lugar.
Durante el recorrido no s√≥lo vamos a descubrir la historia de esta casa y de la ciudad, sino a los personajes que en ella han morado ¬øQu√© relaci√≥n tienen con este lugar Murillo,¬†Luis Montoto, Picasso, Gonzalo Bilbao o Antonio Susillo? ¬†Nos adentraremos a puerta cerrada y bajo la luz de la luna en uno de los lugares m√°s fascinantes de la ciudad para descubrir entre sus muros a ilustres personajes, a hombres y mujeres que hicieron de Las Artes su vida y que nos dejaron su memoria escondida en las estancias de la casa.
En el recorrido podremos disfrutar de su extenso, rico y a veces desconocido patrimonio, no s√≥lo arquitect√≥nico, sino que en nuestro paseo descubriremos obras pict√≥ricas atribuidas a importantes autores como Pablo Picasso, o el ‚ÄúRetrato de Don Jacobo Fitz James Stuart y Falc√≥, XVII Duque de Alba‚Äù pintado por Fernando √Ålvarez de Sotomayor y cedido para su exposici√≥n por la XVIII Duquesa de Alba. Adem√°s de otras pinturas de grandes pintores sevillanos como Garc√≠a Ramos, Gonzalo Bilbao o Alfonso Grosso. Tambi√©n descubriremos algunas de las piezas m√°s importantes de la escultura contempor√°nea sevillana, gracias a la colecci√≥n conservada en la galer√≠a alta.¬† Adem√°s podremos disfrutar de una de las colecciones m√°s importantes de Andaluc√≠a de Arte oriental y la colecci√≥n de Arte contempor√°neo.

En nuestro paseo tambi√©n descubriremos documentos tan interesantes como el original y manuscrito por Murillo por el que funda la ‚ÄúAcademia del Arte de la Pintura‚Äù. Y por supuesto obras curiosas como un capote de paseo autografiado por el propio Pablo Picasso o una escultura de la Diosa romana Pomona, que hoy preside el jard√≠n de la casa pero que en su d√≠a estuvo en la fachada principal del Mercado de la Encarnaci√≥n.
Esta visita nocturna aunar√° Historia, Arte y Memorias de interesant√≠simos personajes, para acercarnos de una manera √∫nica a un lugar excepcional de la ciudad.

Description: En esta apasionante visita vamos a hacer un recorrido por la historia de Sevilla, ya que la construcci√≥n de este conjunto de palacios data del siglo X, cuando el califa Abd Al-Rahman III mand√≥ que se hiciera un nuevo recinto para el gobierno de Isbiliya, nombre musulm√°n de nuestra ciudad, del que a√∫n podemos visitar el patio de la yeser√≠a.A partir de la reconquista, en el a√±o 1248, del periodo cristiano recorreremos el palacio g√≥tico, destacando su conjunto de azulejos, el palacio mud√©jar, construido por el rey Don Pedro I, el cruel, a mitad del siglo XIV, con una maravillosa mezcla de la cultura musulmana y cristiana repartida en sus estancias y patios. Los salones de Carlos V, con su monumental entrada realizada por el arquitecto Van der Borch tras el terremoto de Lisboa de 1755, y en el interior un sal√≥n lleno de tapices hechos al estilo flamenco en el siglo XVIII tambi√©n, que nos cuentan la conquista de T√∫nez de Carlos V.Disfrutar√°s de sus diferentes jardines, llenos de estanques, fuentes y galer√≠as, sin lugar a duda un paseo muy agradable en el que perderse conociendo la vegetaci√≥n del Alc√°zar. Pod√©is imaginar desde ese momento hasta nuestros d√≠as, todo lo que podemos encontrar en el Alc√°zar.Este conjunto de palacios fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad junto a la Catedral y el Archivo de Indias en 1987. Situado en los m√°rgenes del Casco Antiguo, junto a la antigua Juder√≠a (Barrio de Santa Cruz), recibe m√°s de 1 mill√≥n de visitas al a√±o. No se trata s√≥lo de un lugar de gran relevancia hist√≥rica, sino que adem√°s constituye uno de los m√°s bellos y curiosos conjuntos arquitect√≥nicos del pa√≠s, mezclando estilos como el g√≥tico, mud√©jar o barroco.Consideramos que la visita al Alc√°zar de Sevilla es uno de los principales atractivos que tenemos en nuestra ciudad y, por lo tanto, no debes perd√©rtelo si a√∫n no lo conoces

Description: AÔªøn authentic rhythms class held in Sevilla's most local neighborhood and taught by a Flamenco dancer.  Explore and connect with other like-minded people through the art of Flamenco and language of Rhythm. This workshop teaches you how to use your body as a percussion instrument and learn to communicate and understand the codes used between musicians and flamenco dancers in a Tablao or Flamenco performance.  * Held in an authentic Flamenco Studio * Taught by a Flamenco Dancer * Accompanied by a Flamenco Guitar Player * Enjoy tapas, wine or beer included * Option to purchase an entry to see a live Flamenco show (Tablao) This class is for ALL AGES  and ALL LEVELS. My goal as a flamenco dancer is to welcome you into this world so that you can understand the basics of rhythm and what you're seeing when you visit a  flamenco show, or communicate with musicians anywhere in the world. .Ôªø.. OÔªøne of the most important roles in a Flamenco performance is that of a Palmero (the hand clapper). YES, you heard correctly! You won't ever see a flamenco show without one or two people in the back clapping their hands. What they are doing is called making Comp√°s, or in other words, controlling the rhythm of the dance so that the singer, guitar player, and dancer are all on the same page. This important role sounds easy, but there is an art to clapping your hands in Flamenco, and that's exactly what you will learn in this workshop. Ever wonder what's happening when you watch a live Flamenco performance? Most Flamenco Tablaos are improvised, which is the beauty of this ancient art form. In this workshop, you'll learn Flamenco Comp√°s  and Palmas (rhythm and clapping). Once you have the basics of rhythm, we'll show you some codes between musicians, dancers, and palmeros that happen during a live Tablao and put it to the test with a flamenco dancer and a flamenco guitar player! Get to know the real Sevilla through the eyes and soul of Flamenco Bienvenido!
Title: Flamenco Rhythm Class w/ Wine & Tapas + Show
Subtitle: Get to know Sevilla via the perspective of a Flamenco Dancer. Learn the language of rhythm. Includes wine & tapas followed by Flamenco Jam.

Aqu√≠, estar√°s tan cerca de los artistas que podr√°s sentir la pasi√≥n que emana de sus cuerpos y el comp√°s de sus tacones resonar√° en tu coraz√≥n. Adem√°s, te maravillar√°s al contemplar las hermosas pinturas que adornan nuestras paredes, donde el flamenco y los toros se fusionan en una explosi√≥n de colores y emociones. Tambi√©n ofrecemos productos hechos con la fragante flor de azahar, un verdadero deleite para tus sentidos. Ven y d√©jate llevar por la magia de nuestra casa, donde el arte y la cultura flamenca se encuentran en cada rinc√≥n. Este lugar elegante y refinado te har√° vivir el Flamenco en la intimidad, donde la cercan√≠a con los artistas te permitir√° apreciar cada detalle de su arte, mientras disfrutas de una copa de vino.

Description: Embark on an epic adventure through the winding streets of Old Town Seville! Explore the city's rich history and culture as you uncover hidden gems and unravel mysteries. But your journey isn't just about sightseeing - you'll be challenged to solve puzzles, decipher clues, and complete tasks that will take you deeper into the heart of the city. Can you uncover the secrets of Seville's past and become the ultimate city explorer? Join us for this one-of-a-kind event, where the city becomes your playground and the possibilities are endless. The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with unique places, fun clues and challenges, and memorable stories of past and present. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤ 3. Head to the starting pointüìç WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL DO The game is an interactive activity where you are guided by a mobile app through the city. With it, you follow directions and solve very fun puzzles, riddles, and cryptic codes. During the game, you will also visit popular and hidden places in the city while learning fun (and we mean it) stories about them. This is a storytelling experience just as much. The people doing these city exploration games gave them an average rating of 4.7/5 around the world. Join the playground too! ------------------ More about Questo üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Questo is an urban entertainment platform offering thematic real-world exploration games. Description: Experience the soul-stirring rhythms and passionate melodies of authentic Flamenco at Tablao Flamenco La Cantaora Sevilla, combined with the delightful indulgence of a refreshing drink. Immerse yourself in the heart of Andalusian culture as you witness a mesmerizing performance that has captivated audiences for centuries. Upon arrival at Tablao Flamenco La Cantaora Sevilla, you will be greeted by the vibrant ambiance and traditional d√©cor, transporting you to a world of fiery passion and artistic expression. Take a seat in the intimate and cozy setting, perfectly designed to enhance your Flamenco experience. As the show begins, prepare to be swept away by the powerful and emotive performances of renowned Flamenco artists. The skilled dancers, accompanied by talented musicians and soulful singers, will enthrall you with their synchronized footwork, intricate hand movements, and heartfelt vocalizations. Feel the intensity and energy radiating from the stage as the performers effortlessly merge complex rhythms and graceful movements, telling stories of love, loss, and longing. Each dancer's soulful expression and flamboyant costumes will transport you to the heart of Flamenco, evoking a range of emotions within you. To enhance your evening, we have included a refreshing drink for you to enjoy during the show. Sip on a glass of chilled sangria, a traditional Spanish wine cocktail, or indulge in a selection of other beverages available. Let the flavors complement the passion of the performance, as you immerse yourself fully in the sensory experience. Whether you are a Flamenco aficionado or experiencing it for the first time, Tablao Flamenco La Cantaora Sevilla promises an unforgettable evening of cultural immersion and artistic brilliance. Allow the music, dance, and drink to awaken your senses and leave you with lasting memories of this enchanting Spanish tradition.

Subtitle: Immerse in Seville's authentic flamenco show, inspired by 19th-century caf√© cantantes. A intimate, low-capacity setting respects our roots.

Description: You have a glorious opportunity to get your message into the world. Never before has there been such an exciting time in communication. The ability to transmit your words across the world has existed for decades. What has changed a result of COVID-19 is now people are LISTENING. Virtual communication has now been accepted as the norm. People know that they need to tune into the Facebook Lives and join the Zoom meetings otherwise they are going to be left out of the loop. They are ready to hear your message. Are you ready to give it to them? Your phone and your computer are all you need to make a difference in the world. You have a voice, it‚Äôs time to use it. You have a story, it‚Äôs time to tell it. You have a message, it‚Äôs time to share it. Imagine being able to reach people in places you‚Äôve never heard of and changing the lives of people you have never met. That possibility is more real than ever thanks to virtual speaking. You still aren‚Äôt 100% sure about all this, are you? You‚Äôve done some Facebook Lives, you‚Äôve been in some Zoom meetings and you‚Äôve filmed a few selfie videos. You‚Äôre trying things out, but you‚Äôre not as confident as you‚Äôd like to be. It still feels weird not being able to see people. You still feel self conscious seeing yourself on camera. You aren‚Äôt getting the likes and comments that you see other people getting on their lives and videos. Does it feel like you‚Äôve been left behind by all this change? You haven‚Äôt been left behind yet‚Ä¶but you will if you don‚Äôt act now. When the technology arrived to do virtual speaking, only a tiny fraction of people adopted it. During the 2010s they rose to the top of their fields. The ‚Äúsecond wave‚Äù is now here, and you‚Äôve got to catch it if you want to have a meaningful impact during the 2020s. I joined the second wave late. I started my Youtube channel in 2015, 10 years after Youtube had been created. I first used Zoom in 2018, 5 years after Zoom had been created. I was quicker on the uptake with Facebook Live, being one of the first people in my industry to use it in 2016. I didn‚Äôt have the audience nor the engagement of my peers, but I kept learning the craft. When lockdown hit in 2020, I was able to seamlessly transition my business online. I‚Äôd been preparing for half a decade to speak virtually whilst the competition got caught with their pants down. I managed to grow my audience and increase my income in 2020 when so many businesses struggled or even sadly closed up shop. There‚Äôs one thing that made the difference for me and it will make the difference for you too. I knew how to communicate online. I was far more confident with the tech, more practiced in the communication and more open to the switch to virtual. We still have people who don‚Äôt know how to unmute themselves on Zoom. We still have people who speak like an emotionless robot on their Youtube videos. We still have people who think virtual was just a ‚Äúphase‚Äù and not a transition into a new way of doing things. Don‚Äôt be one of those people. The second wave of virtual communication is here...are you going to jump on it? This is going to be far bigger than the first wave. If you don‚Äôt jump on now, you will get swept away. Equally, if you put in the work now to master virtual speaking, you are going to flourish for the next decade. That is what this Virtual Speaking Masterclass is going to help you do. There are three basic building blocks you need to be a great virtual speaker. Firstly you will learn how to make friends with the camera. Making friends with the camera means that you will: Secondly you will learn why it‚Äôs so important to create an ‚Äúactive window‚Äù. An active window means that you: Thirdly you will learn how to effectively interact with your audience. Strong interaction means that your audience will: Are you ready for the second wave? Then grab your surfboard and sign up for the masterclass! In the true spirit of Virtual Speaking, we will of course be hosting this class virtually so that you can join us from the comfort of your own home. FAQs Is this definitely an online event? Because the event has a physical location? Yes this is entirely online. The physical location allows people in your city (such as you!) to find the event as it shows up as being geographically close to them. Where can I access the masterclass? You can attend the masterclass live on Zoom. You will be sent the link on the day of the masterclass. The event repeats each month, do I need to attend on a monthly basis? No. The same series is repeated every month. You only need to attend one event.
Title: Virtual Speaking Masterclass Seville
Subtitle: Online Workshop Teaching You How To Speak Online!

Description: Synthesis of the human Mind Our internal world drives our external world. Our ability to use our mind determines how well we can control our external realities. What you may not know is that our Minds have an identity. Creating an Identity of mind allows us to direct our external world intentionally. The language we use to run our lives is one dimensional, which creates needless limitations. Our minds work best in a multidimensional language. Learning how to access your minds resources correctly will enable you to create a life beyond who we desire to be. Our vocabulary, are words we use internally to motivate change, but instead of encouraging us, the imperfections in our speech and articulation restrict access to our minds. There is no synchronicity between the one-dimensional language in our speech and the 4 th dimension of the mind. If you‚Äôre not using the correct language of the mind, the mind disengages where we become confused. We don‚Äôt have the language to describe the life that we want in a way that the mind accepts, understands, and can utilise. Mind ReMapping is a language illuminating an internal identity, so that we no longer need to be afraid of the dark, neither do we need to be afraid of our minds and what the future holds for us. Meta Tech Organica ‚Äì Excited about Dimensions of LIVING D0 ‚Äì Orientation ‚Äì Who you are & who you are NOT. D1 ‚Äì Point of Focus ‚Äì What Where When Why & How to SEE.
